text: I, along wth the groom's mother hosted a bridal shower for my daughter at Nonno's yesterday and it was spectacular. Delicious food and wonderful service. Our guests raved about everything. My husband and I dine there often when we crave excellent Italian food. It has been our favorite for years. Thanks Lou, Mike, and your wonderful staff.

Very good Italian food. Very classy and elegant, I really enjoyed the vibe that the waiters had. Pino puffs as an appetizer were perfect I would highly recommend and the sauce that comes with. Only problems that I have and the reasons for the 4/5 were the service was slow I felt like my party was forgot about waiting a long time for food, and I ordered the margahrita pizza and I was highly disappointed. If you know how a margahrita pizza is supposed to be made you'd agree. Other than that I had a little bit of meat loaf and the bow tie pasta and I was blown away. Would definitely recommend this spot if you have the time!

Entrees Were Hit or Miss and Wine List Needs Help We joined several friends here for dinner recently after not having been to the restaurant for many years.  I would give the restaurant two stars based on my meal, but because others enjoyed their meals more, I felt three stars were appropriate.  I had shrimp scampi and the linguine was very overcooked, there were no bread crumbs, and the sauce was very bland.  My husband had the cod and clam special and the clams all arrived closed, which is not a good sign.  After fighting to get two of the clam shells to open, he gave up on that.  The preparation of his entree was overly "lemony" which overwhelmed all other flavors. Our friends, who love red wine, ordered a bottle after checking the wine scores of what was on the menu and sampling a couple.  The wine in the bottle represented the best they could find and even then they did not finish it or take it home.  Service was spotty.  Bread basket was never re-filled nor were our water glasses.  Based on my experience I would not recommend.

We had a bridal shower with 65 guest, we were able to have the entire restaurant to ourselves for a sit down lunch at a very reasonable price. Valet was quick and included in our package. We opted for a cash bar and there was a friendly quick bar tender for just our party. Beautiful, modern environment delicious food extremely courteous service. We could not be happier with our experience .

Our favorite! Lou and Mike have been updating their already flavorful menu. I have found a few new favs! The shrimp scampi is delicious! They have also made it very convenient to order any of the items that have been removed from their previous menu. All you have to do is ask! We love the ambience there and always have a good meal at a reasonable price with super friendly waitstaff. You can't go wrong here!

New to neighborhood we ventured to find some good replacements to our old Andersonville stomping ground. After a few misses, we found this across from pizza place and it looked fancier so we tried it. From walking in the place looked fantastic. The bar looked amazing, the ambiance was a delight. We couldn't wait to sit and order. Our salad looked amazing. Dressing too oily. The pasta dishes we all ordered looked delicious. No taste. We really, really wanted to like this place but the food was less than stellar, mediocre at best. Probably win't return. The search continues. The service was great I will add. Just wish the food had flavor.
I liked the food, but would not try the grilled calamari!! The bread was a little hard and it took FOREVER TO get the food. The meals ended up being good though!

We were there yesterday for a dual graduation party yesterday for both of my nieces. My sister did a great job in planning food. There were about 35 of us. 1st course was bruschett, platter of nicely crunchy bread rounds overflowing with nicely seasoned dices tomatoes. Next course was a nicely prepared fresh salad, crisp with red onion, shredded carrots and tomato pieces with a tasteful garlic dressing on the side. Then came the grilled asparagus spears, done perfect, al dente! The roasted potatoes were crispy and moist seasoned just right. The main entree was chicken parmesan, oh my! Huge chicken breasts moist and tender, with the perfect amount of cheese and tomatoes.  The waitress was spot on with all our orders and very attentive. Great service! Free valet parking as well! Wish we lived closer than Aurora, but definitely worth the trip. Thank you Cindy Salamone for  recommending to my sister.

The menu was updated, but not updated on the website. The only reason I came to the restaurant was conveniently taken off. The bread was old and the tiny salad was made up of old vegetables. Overall the expensive from start to finish was a let down.

WOW is what I can start with! Have driven past here several times and tonight we stopped in to eat. Well worth it! Food was excellent! Having several food allergies it is always worrisome eating out. Nonno's was very accommodating and even had gluten free pasta! Portions are large and prices are some of the best around. Salad was included with the meal - homemade dressing was delicious! All the staff was very courteous and nice. Bread and oil is also served at the table. I cannot wait to go back and try the pork chops!!

Went here after work and was happily surprised by the happy hour bar menu that includes a variety of appetizers and entrees for $2.95. We tried the bruschetta, calamari, house salad and two types of pizza. All for under $20! The food is delicious came out hot and quickly. Will definitely be going back!

The service sucked. Our waitress wasn't really attentive to us overall. When asked what we'd like to order to start off with, we were told they didn't have the appetizer we wanted to order , so we asked her to come back in a few minutes. Btw, we were never informed of the "specials" of the menu. It took about 20 mins for her to come back and take our order. We kinda sat there twiddling our fingers, wondering if she's ever coming back. She wasn't attentive to us overall - during our entire dinner, she kept passing our table and didn't even bother to ask if we were doing okay or if we needed anything. The bus boys were more attentive that she was! It's sad. Not sure if we are ever going back there again.

My new Italian Joint, first time there and definitely not the last. All the food was great can't wait to come back and try something different.  Appetizers: Fried calamari was just perfectly lightly battered and very tender. Can't go wrong with that or the crab crakes.  Dinner: Chicken Parm was delicious as well as the Pistachio crusted chicken. Very tasty and delicious.  Dessert: Was too full but couldn't pass up trying the bread pudding and again amazing like the rest of our dinner.  I think our servers name was Jessica and she was so sweet and attentive. Overall I was very impressed and can't wait to go back and try new dishes. Keep up the great work!

I used Nonno Pino's to cater my son's first holy communion. They were a joy to work with and the food is unbelievable in both taste and value. I highly recommend the Asiago chicken but you can not go wrong with anything they offer.

Monday night dinner was vert good, especially when many places are closed on Monday. They have a nice selection of half-price bottles of wine for their special on that day. I had the mushroom ravioli and highly recommend.
Good food extremely bad service  server was very rude. I was a server before. I know the rules of eating and how you do not take anyone's plate until they finish eating. Here they rush you out
Coldest steak ever! Brushetta had 36lbs of tomato and onions on it. And took 15 min to get a drink. Brutality at its finest!
So so so good!! I've been to several parties here and can't wait to throw my own here. They are super accommodating and food is absolutely delicious. Can't wait to come back!

Great place! So adorable and the food is fantastic. My husband had the mushroom ravioli and I had the penne broccoli. The food is delicious and the prices are amazing for what you get. The tirimisu was amazing, as well. Our server was great and the ambiance was, as well. In short, if you can name any aspect you judge a restaurant by, this place is great at it! We never imagined this quality was available outside of downtown Chicago!

I hosted my sisters baby shower this past weekend and the service was amazing! They are very attentive and the food was delicious.  I scheduled a party for 40 people and only 32 of my guests showed up.  They charged me for the amount of guests that attended which they didn't have to do.  Mike was very accommodating with the menu and great communicator.  I would definitely host another event here anytime!

I have never dined on the restaurant but I use their catering for large work events (100+ people) and every time I think it can't get any better...it does. Mike is absolutely a delight to work with. If you give him your price/person and a concept, he makes magic happen---even going outside of their listed menu items. He emailed me today with suggestions for menus for upcoming events and I could not be more pleased. I have never seen him before but after today, I want to meet him and hug him. (I won't because that is not professional and maybe a little creepy, but the man totally saved my skin. I'm happy, don't judge me!)  We have never gotten as many compliments about the food as we do when we use Nonno Pino's. So far we have had the following (I'm going to butcher these spellings, sorry!!): Chicken with mushrooms, chicken marsala, giambotta, beef braciole, tomato cream pasta, and a few or their salad options. My favorites are the chicken with mushrooms and tomato cream pasta. The pasta is a meal in itself and I would highly recommend it for vegetarians because it's such a substantive selection- you seriously don't miss the meat. Even though we usually select a meat/pasta/salad menu, whenever we have vegetarians, they never complain about not having a third option because the pasta and salads are that satisfying. Their delivery is on time, and the food is always piping hot and made to serve fresh. You never feel like it was sitting under a heat lamp or drying out in an oven somewhere.  You simply cannot go wrong with using Nonno Pino's to cater your next event.
Came here one night because of a recommendation from a neighbor.  Overall the food was delicious and very reasonably priced.  I was not blown away, however and I have not been back since.

Haven't been in awhile. My wife had made a reservation for four people  and when we arrived we found out it got lost/dropped somehow.  Hostess was very apologetic and gracious. Asked us if we minded sitting at the bar for a few and got us a round of drinks while we waited. THANKS!. A short wait and we got a table. Service was great, food was delicious. Dinner, dessert a few drinks later and we were good to go. Very relaxed atmosphere and a pleasant dining experience. Would recommend and will be going back.

While visiting Niles, I decided to try Nonno Pino's in Edison Park for dinner after previewing their menu online. It was most definitely worth the stop and lived up to my expectations. The lasagna was excellent. The flavor was perfect without being overly salty. The portion size was just right, neither too big nor too small. With the included house salad and warm bread, I had just the right amount of food for a nice dinner. My server, Erica, was very friendly and very attentive without being pushy. She made me feel welcome from the moment I sat down. It was clear that she truly enjoyed her job and her customers. Nonno Pino's is in an older building in downtown Edison Park. Keeping the original brick walls and the high, tin ceiling gave the restaurant a unique atmosphere. The tablecloths and white linen napkins gave the restaurant an air of sophistication. At the same time, the environment was not at all pretentious. It was the type of place where friends would go for a nice, Italian dinner. The bar at the front of the restaurant was perfect for those who wanted to enjoy a drink and some socialization before or after dinner. Luigi, the owner, was very cordial and made sure that all of his guests had an enjoyable experience at Nonno Pino's. I would definitely go back for dinner the next time I am in the area.

Attended belated Christmas party this past Saturday evening at Nonno Pino's  and it was terrific. The delicious food, drinks, and service were the best.  Mike and Lou always make sure all your needs are met.  Wonderful time had by all.  Can't wait to go back again!

Love the pistachio crusted chicken and rustic salad. Always request the bread and oil/cheese to start. I have dined in Nonno Pino's at least 2 times per year and catered my Christmas Eve dinners too many times to count. Great food, great service, great atmosphere.
The service is so so, the food makes up for the service. Never had a bad meal, topped off with dessert and cappuccino. (A little wine don't hurt)

This is a review of the catering service. This was a great experience. Our party called for catering to about 40 people, and the staff at Nonno Pinos were a pleasure to work with. The cost was quite reasonable and they offered timely delivery of the large order. There were many compliments on the excellent food, especially the meatballs and sausage and peppers. Pastas and sandwiches were a hit too. Everyone I spoke to over the phone was very nice and accommodating. Would definitely order again!

We were looking for places for lunch catering for work (~100 people) and decided to give Nonno Pino's a try.  They are not open for dine-in lunch M-F, but they offer catering and private dining.  We've ordered twice now (Halloween and the day before Thanksgiving) and the food has been great!  We've had everything from eggplant rolls, to chicken, to pasta, to turkey, and everything in between.  People actually enjoy the food because it's delicious and get seconds (or thirds).  Very reasonably priced for what you get, and always delivered on time and fresh.  You really can't beat the value for the food that you get!  Great job!
Food was excellent. Service below average.  Seem to have a very bad sewer fly issue...as they were flying around the table while we were having dinner! Very annoying

My husband and I celebrated our wedding here last year.  We had a small, intimate party of just our blended family and parents.  The food was amazing!  Everyone loved it!  They allowed us to take pictures while we were there, too!  Thank you, Nonno Pino's!!!

Went to Nono Pino's for a baby shower on a Sunday. They have complimentary valet and the family had rented out the entire space! It was very cute and cozy.  The food was excellent. Very authentic and flavorful Italian food. The menu they had selected for the shower was BIG. We started with the fried calamari and the Pino puffs. The pino puffs were fantastic. I wish we had more.. They were basically friend zucchini balls. So tasty! The calamari was great, too. Then we had a lovely salad, followed by a vodka pasta and a choice of entree. I had their asiago chicken and it was unbelievable. They also served cheesecake and pumpkin cheesecake for dessert, both of which were fantastic.  I'd love to go back and try other things on the menu. I highly recommend Pino's for intimate parties and gatherings. Great service, great atmosphere, and great food!  The only reason why I didn't give this place a 5 is because the location... Although it is in a cute spot, it's very congested. I was so relieved that they had valet because street parking is limited.

Love this restaurant! Not only do we frequent for dinner but my parents threw my fiancé and I an engagement party here and it was INCREDIBLE. The food, service and atmosphere was perfect. Mike and Luigi were so patient and accommodating - we had to have been in 4+ times arranging and rearranging the layout prior to the party and they were always so welcoming. The food was amazing and everyone had a great time! I would highly recommend this restaurant!

The owner does a nice job with the food and ambiance.  In the summer he can open the front windows to expose the entire front half of the restaurant to the sidewalk. Their Pino puffs (deep fried zucchini, cheese balls) are soooo good.  Also their fried calamari is on point, never spongy always crispy. Their meat sauce is unreal as well.  We have all our private parties here. They will open early for parties and give you the whole restaurant (minimum persons ofcourse). Nice to be treated like VIPS everytime we come in.  5 STARS!

What an amazing restaurant !! We had my daughter's baby shower here.The hosts were fantastic-the food was amazing and the  ambiance is a "10". The valet parking is a definite plus and the attendants were very accommodating.We will have great memories of a perfect shower!

Real and Wonderful local Italian place. Top notch food and service. Mike- you rock! Accommodated our every request, with limited notice( our original place closed last minute) and drinks/ food flowed magnificently. And we prefer the authentic courses as you offer. Everyone had a really nice time at my sons rehearsal dinner.  My daughter is begging to go back for more crab cakes :-). Thanks again! And you have got your self a whole new group of happy regulars. Ps Kudos to valets kids too- no doubt local High schoolers. Its very tough to find parking on the NW side!
Excellent Italian food. The broth of the grilled calamari is enough to keep me coming back. Service is warm and friendly.

Great place to gather with family, friends or your significant other. The staff make you feel like family and they always have great recommendations on food and wine. I've been to a few showers here and I must say it is a cute place to host a party. The rustic decor makes you feel like you are dining in a restaurant in Italy. Super cute neighborhood restaurant in Edison park, huge thumbs up! For appetizers I recommend their baked clams or their baked goat cheese, the crab cakes are good as well. For dinner I recommend the pistachio crusted chicken or the seafood ravioli...two of my many favorites. For dessert you cannot go wrong with an Italian classic...tiramisu.
Pretty crappy to be closed during "Edison Park Restaurant Week" for a private party. Always loved the food but lost my business for good.

The food was good but, the service was mediocre. Our server forgot their own menu and when it came to the dessert, we asked to take it home....I looked at the container and it was a super tiny piece of cheesecake that would make you feel insulted, it didn't even looked inviting to eat. I gave a good tip but, I don't think I'm coming back. Sorry. Food good, service not so much.

We had our wedding shower this weekend and can not say enough great things! Everything was perfect and everything I could want. They made some accommodations for me and they food was absolutely amazing! I can for sure say that they gained a lot of new customers after the great service and amazing food! We can't wait to go back again! Mike and Katie were fantastic to work with planning and Luigi was with us day of and made sure everything was running perfect and kept checking in on us to make sure it stayed that way! If you are planning a party for a special event I can not recommend them enough! Also it was priced better than any place we looked at we got so much more for our money then anywhere else!! Thank you to the team who took such great care of us!! Matt and Valerie

With so many Italian restaurants clustered together in the area that Nonno Pino's is located, this particular restaurant was lack-luster in comparison to some of their competitors.  It's my belief that with so many other restaurants offering up pasta, pizza and the typical plates you have to find a way to make yourself stand out and unfortunately Nonno Pino's did not achieve this.  In fact, Nonno Pino's is no more unique than is a tall person (such as myself) who plays basketball (also, myself).  I'd have loved to come here and say anything but this, but I've also been scolded when I tell lies, therefore I can't say anything other than what I'm telling you. My apprehension about this restaurant was first initiated when it took 15 minutes for our waitress to take our order...and even longer to get our food, but I'll get back to that later...just as our waitress had gotten back to us later, much later.  While waiting for our waitress to pull herself away from laughing with her co-workers I was able to enjoy the ambience of the restaurant.  It is very spacious and has the availability to seat large parties, but even though the restaurant was big it felt cozy.  Although it's decorated nicely, it's not fancy and thank goodness for that because I showed up wearing sweatpants with hair that looked a hot mess.  Maybe I wasn't pretty enough for our waitress and that's why she was so incredibly slow?  In case I haven't given enough of a picture - we arrived about an hour before closing and it took 15 minutes for our waitress to take our order, 20 more minutes to get our appetizer, 20 more minutes to get our entrée, about 10 more minutes for our dessert order to be taken and 10 more minutes + 2 requests for our check to come.  Essentially, we were there longer than what was necessary because our waitress was busy twirling her hair...obviously she didn't care about getting out of work on time.   Sorry for the rant guys, but you have to know that you are not going to be in and out of the door if coming to Nonno Pino's.  However, we're here to talk about the food so let's do that.  We started with the fried rigatoni appetizer which was quite delicious, but I enjoyed the appetizer more than the actual entrée - the seafood ravioli.  The menu listed this item as "spicy" and it was listed in such a way that made me think the ravioli was stuffed with seafood.  Nope and nope.  It was not spicy at all and there was simply some seafood (which didn't seem that fresh) scattered on top of the cheese ravioli.  Deception!  Lies!  And more lies!  The food was decent, but I definitely would not be inclined to order it again.  We also ordered the side of sausage which was again, okay, but super greasy.  We were able to round off our dinner with a highlight: the tiramisu!  I always love, love, love my tiramisu and they do it well here.  Basically, I wish I'd have stuck with just the appetizer, dessert and the complimentary bread and olive oil (yummy!).  I'm thinking some of the other normal pasta is better than the entrée I'd gotten. The silver lining was that the food here at Nonno Pino's is appropriately priced and there's no big complaint about that - I just wish the food would have been more authentically Italian and I so wish the service was better, especially since this is a lovely little family-owned restaurant in cute old Edison Park.

We are in the Niles area of Chicago visiting family. Stopped in this restaurant about 7:30 after arriving in O'hare. We wanted a big salad with grilled chicken. The salad and bread was excellent! Didn't sample the main courses but for a "stop in" without any knowledge of the food, it was a good experience in a neighborhood place. Recommend it!

LOVE Nonno Pino! Delicious food. Excellent service. The pistachio chicken and all of the pasta dishes are delicious as are their salads. The service is great too. One time we were in there and  asked for our side salad to go. They brought it out as a side rather than in a to-go container which wasn't a big deal to us and we were just going to eat it. Once our waitress realized (without us mentioning anything) she took the salad back, apologized, and sent us home with an extra salad. That was above and beyond.

I've been coming to this place for over 20 years and I always like coming back.  The food is good at a reasonable price.  The service is great and they always take care of you. I went again there this last weekend and the valet was having trouble with my car.  I was about to go out there the the manager told me to go back to my table and he would take care if it.  I was impressed to stay the least.  Love this place, keep up the great work.

Yum-o! This is our favorite neighborhood Italian spot. We've had at least half the menu and everything is delicious. We are particular fans of the grilled calamari, crab cakes, prosciutto pizza and their bolognese is top notch. Service and atmosphere is also always great.
Had awesome time !!' Food and service was spectacular. Glad we came here instead of morreti around the corner We will be back.
We hosted a baby shower here for my SIL, We did an ala carte menu, which was kind of cool.   All of our guests were very satisfied and there was plenty of delicious food to go around.

This place is absolutely fantastic! It has a wonderful atmosphere, valet parking and the food is incredible. I went with a group of 4 people. We shared fried zucchini and cheese balls and fried calamari. These apps were incredible! I got a bowtie pasta dish with sausage, peppers and ricotta cheese and my husband got a cheese crusted chicken with a cream sauce and pasta with fresh tomatoes and basil. It was some of the best Italian dishes we have ever had. Becky was our waitress and she is SUCH A DOLL! We all loved her! What a place to go for a fantastic meal

We live in the neighborhood and enjoy eating here.  The food and service are always very good, plus they're kid friendly.  Walked there with our kids tonight and we were told it would be a 30 minute wait.  Hostess allowed us to leave our cell phone number, so we could take our children to the park across the street while we waited.  Called us 20 minutes later and had a table waiting for us.  I LOVE that they allowed us to do that without batting an eye or making me feel guilty for asking.  The kids menu is very reasonably priced and the kids love to color on the butcher paper on the table.  Some of our go to items are the pino puffs (my finicky 10 year old even likes these) and the gnocchi.

Fantastic once again!  We always use and will continue to always use Nonno Pino's to host, cater our parties and events!  Everything is top notch!   Just had my daughters communion luncheon today and the service and food was fantastic!! They never disappoint!!!

I held my daughter's bridal shower here on Feb. 14, 2016.  Everything from beginning to end was the best it could be!  This was a shower for 50 and the service was excellent.  Servers were very friendly and on top of everything.  The entrees were served immediately, so everything was hot, including the fish, which was one of the entree choices.  Everything else was plentiful and I'm pretty sure no one went home hungry.  Mike and Lu were great work with as I made all the arrangments, they were very flexible.  The price per person is very competitive and really a great value, for the quality and amount of food you get.  I would highly recommend this restaurant for your next event!

This is our favorite restaurant in Edison Park! My husband and I love coming here. The staff is amazing and the food is delish! Mike, Katie, and Becky are very welcoming and accommodating! The pino puffs are my favorite;) great place!! Thanks for all the great food and memories!
My wife and I come here regularly,love this place,food is excellent and the people who work here do an great job,I highly recommend
Great food. If you're in the Edison Park area and looking for some good Italian food this is the place.

This has become our local go-to Italian restaurant - perfect for when the kids are in from school or before family events. I've never been disappointed in a meal - the menu seems fairly standard but the food is always well prepared and served relatively quickly.  What I like most about Nonna Silvia's is the atmosphere. There's always a good mix of locals, families, couples, etc., and you're not crammed on top of each other so conversation is easy and expected. The staff is always accommodating and friendly - not exactly a given today with restaurants.  Hard to believe this place has been around as long as it has been - it's surprising that a casual, airy Italian restaurant like this was missing on the NW Side before they opened. Valet parking is great because Edison Park can get pretty busy.  It's nice to have a great local place that isn't part of a chain - hope they stay in business for a long time.

Really excellent food.  Yeah.  So sad this place is nowhere near us.  Sniffle. Met my folks here for dinner, my mom picked it.  And we never would have found it otherwise.  What a great pick though.  We all enjoyed it thoroughly. Very large open space so it can get a little loud in there but it's surprisingly not too bad.   They all shared the fried calamari and said it was fantastic.  I had four cheese ravioli, dad had lasagna, mom had a chicken dish, and I think the sweetheart had a special.  Large portions and everything was so tasty.  Soup or salad comes with all dishes so man, we were stuffed.  Prices are reasonable too.  I mean, we were in shock, this place hit all the right marks! Service was great, our server was very friendly and nice. All in all, a great place to go and we hope to somehow get back out this way for dinner again sometime as it will definitely be worth the trip.  A big hit in our book for sure!

What a sweet surprise this evening. After driving around the area searching for a place to eat, I stumbled upon this enticing spot. The Mushroom Ravioli was wonderful. The grilled calamari was light and complex at the same time. A great find after all these trips down Northwest Highway.  Looking forward to the next visit.

I never would have found this place without the Groupon, but so glad I did.  Very good food, generous portions (my husband loved his piece of blackened salmon, and normally they are served so tiny), and I loved it all!  Thank you so much for offering it.  I will be back! Much bigger place than I pictured and I wasn't sitting on top of my neighbors, which was VERY nice. And Monday night half price bottles of wine?  Who can resist?

One of my favorite places for happy hour 5-7pm Monday - Friday. The food is amazing and for a happy hour you can't beat the prices. Martinis are very well made and the food is a steal for the price. Great local Italian restaurant to eat at and still one of my favorite places to go!!

Pork Balsamic was absolutely delicious. Whoever made the salad was lazy; people like bite size pieces but most people do not have mouths the size of tires. Creamy garlic dressing way too sweet. Our group of 8 which included a toddler and a handicapped individual had a reservation and still had to wait a full half-hour to be seated. The host insincerely apologized without looking at anyone and comped two desserts - big whoop.  I've been here before and enjoyed it very much when here for a private party - on this visit the noise level was deafening, so much so that it was difficult to speak with others seated nearby and more than myself left with a pounding headache. I'd return for a private event but never ever ever ever for dinner when the place is full (weekend).  Never ever!

This is our go-to place for Italian food in the neighborhood.  They are accommodating and the food is very good.  Our children always get a taste of Italy when they eat their homemade pizzas.  The wine and drink list is decent, and the food is affordable.  Totally recommend!
Went to nonno pino's tonight with my wife for the first time, the new manager, I think it was Katie R, was amazing and our server was excellent.  This place is amazing!!!!

This is always a great standby place to go.  I have always loved their food.  Wine is reasonably priced (mostly between $25 and $35 a bottle) and the food is solid. The marinara sauce is among the best.  The pasta is OK.  There used to be a time when they offered 8 fingered cavatelli, sausage tortellini and polenta fries... I still miss those items and quite honestly has kept us from frequenting this place as much as we used too.  The meatballs are fantastic, Pino Puffs is the sole "original dish" that I could consider coming back for that I can't get at all of the competition.  The mushroom ravioli is different... Chunks of mushroom with the ground mushroom ravioli...it's OK.  I changed the sauce to have the red sauce instead of the garlic and olive oil.. It may have been better to stick with the original menu selection.  The NY Strip my partner had was out of this world awesome!  Seasoned well... Service is awesome though.  They had no gelato on our night as whoever provides it to them does a solid job when they have it.. -:(. So we saved a few bucks and had some when we got home.

Italian restaurant and gluten and dairy free requirements very rarely are outstanding. This is the exception, service with a smile, never feeling like a nuisance for having dietary restrictions. Great ambience, awesome food, great bar, fresh, fresh fresh and delicious. Started with grilled calamari, then side salad and gluten free pasta with sausage marinara...amazing!

In short, as we were leaving Nonno Pino's after a fantastic dinner, one of my girlfriends turned to me and said, "I hope you Yelp! the shit out of this place!"  That's the cliff's notes version! A group of 5 of us (plus carseat w/ newborn) had dinner at Nonno Pino's on Thursday night to celebrate a birthday.  I had called and made a reservation, which was easy.  The host was happy to seat us and even gave us an option of where to sit to best accommodate the baby. Our server, Erica (or Erika? or Ericka?) was fantastic.  She was fun, energetic, happy to give recommendations, answer questions and check things with the kitchen (food allergies, etc.) and genuine.  She loves working at Nonno Pino's and it shows.  We're a low-key group, so after ordering a round of drinks, we were ready to order dinner.   Firstly, A+ to Nonno Pino's for offering to sub up a caprese, caesar, beet, or rustic salad for only $1.50 with an entree rather than a standard house salad.  Big points in my book.  Huge.  By now everyone knows how I love a beet salad... Secondly, the bread w/ oil & parm - normally, I don't even include this in my review, because it is table bread.  Not this bread.  It was warm, crusty, and fresh, and the parmesan cheese was fantastic with the olive oil. I ordered the New York strip, which comes with grilled asparagus and crispy potatoes.  The temp on the steak was PERFECT, and it was slathered in a compound garlic butter, which I also used for the asparagus. Everyone else at the table enjoyed their meal as well - actually, everyone was RAVING about it. We ordered two desserts to share, which Nonno Pino's comped both for the birthday we were celebrating.  What an awesome gesture. I will absolutely be back to Nonno Pino's for a casual, no frills, delicious Italian meal.

I was there for a private party.  The manager and staff were helpful while I set up our decorations.  But our waitress, Jess, was outstanding!  The food as always was excellent.  Great garlic salad dressing and pasta.  Overall a great experience with great food.

My boyfriend & I have come in on a few occasions and it's safe to say it's definitely my favorite Italian place in Edison Park :)) love the Breaded Rigatoni & Bowtie Chicken Pasta! So yummy! I love a good glass of wine and I've been impressed with every type of wine I've tried. Service is always exceptional & very friendly! Can't wait to return!

I went here for a friends party and it was very nice. The food was delicious and definitly more than enough to save for left overs. I was full after half of my meal and it was truely a wonderful experience.
Nonno's has tasty Italian food, and good wine.  Service has always been excellent, and they have good deals on appetizers at the bar (M-F 5-7).

The food here was delicious! Great options for carnivores and vegetarians. Their risotto was creamy and warm. Perfect for a cold night. I had the Fettuccine Alfredo, which is impossible to mess up. However they added their own flare and somehow made it more memorable. I love the decor in this place. Warm. Inviting. Felt like a place away from home. The only downfall is waiting, they don't have room for guests waiting. During the winter, we had to stand out. It was horrible. But the food made up for it.

Amazing!!! Food is amazing!!! Gotta get here. This is the best place. The thing I love is the service and the food. The food has been consistent for 18 years. Can't beat that. This is my top 5 places to eat and it will be yours as well.

I returned to Nona Pina with a new group of out of town friends. In contrast to our previous experience, this visit was flawless. One guest had pistachio crusted chicken. When she asked for a substitution of broccoli instead of pasta she was given a huge serving of perfectly steamed broccoli. The chiken itself was juicy and quite tasty. My other guest chose the seafood.  He said it was very delicious. I'm glad to see that our earlier visit was an exception to the normally excellent food and service presented by this restaurant. Thanks for an enjoyable evening.
Seafood ravioli is amazing! Bar service is also great. Pistachio crusted chicken salad was delicious.

Nonno Pino has very good pasta dishes!  My wife orders the Penne Broccoli dish all the time. Their bow tie pasta is excellent, as well. If you order a salad, their creamy garlic dressing is the best choice!  Wine selections are good (if you like Malbecs, try the Broquel). Cocktail prices are very reasonable.  They offer 2.95 appetizers in the bar area and half-price bottles of wine with an entree on Mondays!  A MUST try if you're in the Edison Park area!
Fantastic food excellent service. I go here every time I come into town. Love this place. Not a chain just great food and service!

We got to our dinner date and we didn't see a waiter in sight. The hostess noticed and came over, she was classy and professional. She took our drink order and when she delivered our drinks...she said they were on the house. Our waiter was also apologetic and professional. PS the food was great too!

Best meal I've had in the area! Everything was wonderful about this place. The service was great and the food was even better! Angel hair with Alfredo sauce and chicken was delicious. Homemade salad dressing and fresh bread was great. Very reasonably priced too! I would absolutely recommend.

A solid 3 stars. We headed in on a random weeknight and I was surprised to see it was rather busy. We were seated right away though. I looked over the drink menu and picked out a wine. When I ordered it, I was told they were out of it. And my next choice. And my next choice. Same thing with my husband's beer choices. Do they regularly run out of alcohol mid-week? Kind of annoying. The food sure was tasty though. To start, we tried the lasagna rolls. Wow, that was a lot of food. It could have been a main course. I definitely filled up on the appetizer, which was A-OK by me - I knew I'd have leftovers. I had the prosciutto and arugula pizza and it was delicious. It just hit the spot with its mix of salty and cheesy combination. My husband had one of the pasta dishes, and he liked it.  I was offered to have my remaining pizza wrapped up and readily agreed. When I opened the doggy bag the next day, I was surprised to see the pizza had been thrown in there and a lot of the arugula was gone. Did it get thrown out? What the heck?

Walked in "wasted" after 5 Duvels and told waitress we needed something to absorb the liquor. She recommended "bread" and we ordered the prosciutto pizza. When it came, I was concerned as it was piled high with arugula- totally not what pizza should look like. But it was delish- fresh olive oil, gentle cheese and all around outstanding flavor.  I would come back sober and have dinner!

Was there for dinner at 7:30 p.m. As soon as we sat down we ordered appetizer and dinner. Then 10 minutes later the appetizer came that was good and the waitress never came back to our table she was too busy with bigger tables of three or more customers. She came and check to see if our meal was delivered around 8:30 pm and we told her we haven't even received our salad yet. The manager came and said he will comp our appetizer big deal I would have paid for that. Then our dinner came at 8:40 I had a butter squash ravioli which ones are special it was so salty I couldn't eat it my husband had crusted chicken and that was burnt. It seems like they would fit together at the last minute and gave it to us won't be coming back I can get better service and food in the neighborhood

Delishes food. Had chicken Marsala and mushroom ravioli. Both excellent. Definitely going back. One thing service was just ok. First waitress totally forgot us once we sat down then some other waitress noticed us sitting there and everything was fine after that. Will try this place again for sure because food was great and see how the service is next time.
Great food and great service! The penne broccoli was really good and the lasagna was amazing!! Nice sized portions and great ambience!

Easily my favorite neighborhood spot. Just as good for a grown-up dinner and wine as it is for us to bring our two young kids for a far better meal than we could find at any of the obnoxious family-centric chain restaurants. Great Italian staples, not-to-be-missed specials -- my husband and I both swear by the braciole -- and the perfect in-between atmosphere of quiet-but-not-too-quiet. The desserts are fantastic -- almond tiramisu and homemade bread pudding both stellar. The staff is authentically friendly, and the room is beautiful. A very well-run restaurant, top to bottom.

Have been looking forward to dining here for some time now.  Great looking place in Edison Park.  Good ambience, and looks popular.  Enjoyed the wine selection and timely service. However that's where it ends.  The food presentation was good.    Ordered the new York strip looked great, but a bit to charred on outside and to raw on inside.  Taste of steak and potatoes just very bland not tasty.  Best part was the asparagus.  My guest had chicken vesuvio.  Stated chicken and potatoes were also bland.  Bread also a bit stale. I've heard good things about this place and will give it another try.

It was just okay. My husband and I hadn't been there in a long time and really wanted to go. It have a great atmosphere. The staff is very nice. But I wish I would have ordered something else. I had the Penne Pancetta. It sounded good but had way, way to much oil. The menu doesn't offer a lot.  If I go back, it would be for drinks and apps.

My favorite spot in EP and there's some real good competition around there.  Exceptional staff.  Love the atmosphere, classy and cool, but casual with the exposed brick and welcoming servers.  Every meal has been delicious.
Go during happy hour or half off wine Mondays. Great food!  Great atmosphere!  Try the Blackened Salmon...you won't be disappointed.

Catered for a business lunch at the Resurrection hospital not too far from the restaurant, good Italian portions. The house salad was very fresh and tasty. The person who took my order was Katie, excellent customer service.

I love coming here on Thursdays for martini nights!!! Love their appetizers, haven't had too many of their entrees (due to martinis) but they look delicious. Service is very prompt and friendly!! Never had a bad experience in here

Nono Pinos has all the makings of my favorite restaurant just a short drive from home.  The fish is delicious and pasta is fresh with great sauces.  I really liked the Pino Puffs which are kind of like cheese filled hush puppies.  The decor is minimalistic (brick walls and some paintings here and there), but the tables are properly spaced to ensure you don't get over cramped.  The service was attentive and I enjoyed my experience here last night.

Came here for dinner and didn't have a reservation however they sat us right away! Which was great! I am giving it 3 stars because I wasn't too impressed with the entree that I ordered. I ordered the pistachio crusted chicken. The chicken was ok... And the polenta was blah! In the past whenever I ordered anything that comes with polenta it was usually soft with flavor. This polenta was cooked differently! On a brighter note, the baked goat cheese was the appetizer we chose and it was very good! I would try this place again but order something different.. It could of been what I ordered. It's very cute inside and staff was friendly!

great summertime restaurant....nice italian food.....great neighborhood to walk around after....can't really go wrong with anything........the people that have negative reviews about the food.... they should really just stay at olive garden....as this is probably to much to wrap their culinary minds around..it would free up some of the wait time on the weekends

This place is great. Been here a few times and the food is delicious! The baked goat cheese is awesome. Their Italian dressing is also great. Not sure why, but it's better than any others I've had! Definitely will continue dining here.
Love this place, the pistacio chicken is fantastic, I keep coming back for that. The service is great and prices are decent. Free Vallet is also very convenient as well.

I came here for a Christmas party and prayed for death just after seeing the menu and the dumb twittering customers  all over this tacky place.   Any those gangsters on the wall made to look cool and aged?  What is up with that?   It felt like Red Lobster  or Olive Garden crowds.  Way overpriced and serving the easiest,  quickest,  laziest , highest- margin, Italian food any dumb chef can make.   None of the water servers and cleanup crews speak English.  Any Italian cook knows that this place serves up the easiest dishes and no challenging seafood or meat dishes.    It is all easy pasta and sauces all cheesed up.  The drinks are 90% ice and syrup.  The only one doing any real work is the valet kid parking your car.  God bless that kid for parking my car in that horrible location.   I didn't pay a penny for dinner but my friends in prison eat better that what we had.   Don't waste your time,  get off your butt off the couch and buy a cook  book  from a real old Italian woman ( not the food network phonys )  and make your own tomato sauce and fresh pasta and your understand.   See you at the library.

I would go back, food is above average.  I had the crusted talipia which was just ok, I think I just ordered the wrong thing because everyone else's meal was stellar.  I tried the mushroom ravioli, cream of mushroom soup, and tiramisu for desert.....all delicious.  One of my favorite parts was how they served the bread with a plate of olive oil, parmesan cheese, and olives.  Definitely takes some self discipline not to pig out on that.  Service was great, we were all happy campers.

Food is excellent but watch out for falling dead bugs. Bad experience that one time and they weren't even going to do anything about it. Lost my appetite. 2nd time here I was a little cautious...lol. But food is great.

Snotty wait staff.  I won't be back, especially with all the other options in the area.   My husband, young daughter and I went there for an EARLY Friday night dinner.  As in 5:45pm.  The only other tables that were seated all had kids - many of then young.  Our waitress, I feel like I shouldn't giver her name, took a solid 5+ minutes to approach our table all while other tables were being attended too.  She was not friendly at all and was abrupt when we asked questions.  She didn't come with a wine list nor did she know the specials.   We took a minute to review the menu and many minutes later my husband saw her chatting with the bartender and then the hostesses.  We felt completely ignored, in a not yet busy restaurant. Our food came, my husband like the baked rigatoni.  I had the mushroom ravioli and thought there was NOTHING restaurant worthy about it - at all.  I could have made it at home and saved myself $15.  It was border-line tasty.  The pasta was clearly not freshly made. As w were finishing up we saw a table of ladies being sat near us and noticed how our waitress's demeanor changed when talking to them.  She clearly wanted nothing to do with us.  I get it, we had a small child with us, but we were there SO early and we were out of there by 7pm.  I honestly feel that we were discriminated against because of our child.  Discriminate may be a strong word but that is how rude our waitress was. Like I said, we will not be back.  With or without our child. UPDATE - the management contacted me and had a great customer service tone.  Maybe the waitress had a off night but it still irks me.  Kudos to the manager though, speaks a lot for how the really run the place.

LOVE Nonno's.  It's our go to place for bridal showers and, of course, frequent dinners.  The atmosphere is warm and inviting.  We are never rushed, the food is consistently good, and the staff is exceptional.  Especially, manager, Katie McFadden.  Katie goes beyond the norm in making sure everything is up to her standards, and is genuinely happy to be of service to her patrons.  A gem in Edison Park!

My husband and I ate here recently to celebrate our anniversary.  The free valet is such a nice perk.  The food was excellent and our waiter was helpful when we couldn't decide between two appetizers.  The Pino Puffs were SOOOOOO great, and we also had the Baked Goat Cheese.  The glasses of wine were generously poured.  Really enjoyed our experience.  The one thing that was a negative is that one of the hostesses was dressed very inappropriately in my opinion.  She was young and wearing a very tight, short, black leather skirt.  I'd expect something like that on a cocktail waitress in Vegas, but I don't expect to see that at a family-friendly restaurant.  It's probably just a generational thing, it's probably current fashion, but it stuck out in my mind.  That aside, fabulous restaurant for date night, girl's night, etc.

I went here for the second time tonight with the boyfriend. I just felt like drinking and didn't really want the loud bar scene of The Snuggery.  Ladies, the Pomegranate Martini (with a sugar rim) is a must. The bf also liked his Manhattan. We got the Pino Puffs with our drinks. So soft, warm, and delicious. They're definitely our favorite appetizer here.  This is a really nice, casual spot. Staff is very friendly. We sat at the bar both times we've been here and the bartender/server has always been pleasant.  The first time we came here was for dinner and we ordered a pizza. It wasn't anything spectacular, but it was good. We'd probably order it again. I can't wait to try more of the menu.

I just rediscovered this neighborhood gem last evening with some colleagues after a 8 year hiatus.  I always remembered it being good but didn't often have a chance to be in the area.   It's a rustic and warm place with exposed brick and interesting things on the walls.  The service was delightful...knowledgeable and funny and she kept the pace of our food in sync with the energy at our large table of 7.  She even recognized that we were celebrating and comped one of our desserts (without us telling her...nice touch). We ordered a few appetizers and a variety of pasta and meat dishes for entrees.  I'm told the filet and roasted pork special were fabulous and my pasta dish, Bowtie Arrosto was outstanding!  The sauce was very similar to what I make at home and I've never had a commercial establishment even come close and Nonno Pino did!  We had several bottles of wine and I appreciated the size of the selection and affordability of everything on the list.  We also enjoyed a gelato, chocolate cake and cannoli for dessert and we cleaned our plates!  There are many great dining options on this stretch of Northwest Highway but in my opinion you won't find a better, more reasonably priced meal with the surroundings to match anywhere else.

I love this place!!!  We live in the neighborhood and have eaten here quite a bit.  The pino puffs appetizer is delicious.  I usually get one of the specials or a pasta for dinner and everything I've tried has been really fresh, well prepared, and tasty.  I took my dad here once and he said the salmon was the best he had ever had... which is saying something coming from him.  I believe Monday or Tuesday they have half price bottles of wine which is a great deal.  This place is rarely, if ever, crowded which is unfortunate because it is such a gem of a restaurant.  We have also eaten at the more popular Zia's across the street but it is more expensive and their food is not as good in my opinion.  Stick with Nonno Pino's and you won't be disappointed!!!

My wife and I have been here twice. Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Both times I thought the food was subpar as if all they did was heat up a frozen dinner in the back room. ( I have actually tasted Bertolli frozen meals that have been much better)  This was three years ago and have not been back since. We received a $50.00 gift certificate from a friend 2 years ago but have never used it. We keep saying that we should just go there and have a few drinks but still have not gone back.

Even though I've lived in the neighborhood for 6 years, I went here for the first time last week with a girlfriend for a moms night out.  The food to me was average but good, but what I liked was the friendly neighborhood atmosphere.  We were warmly greeted by a man whom I think is the owner, and our waitress was attentive in a genuine and casual way. Great place to hang out and chat with a friend. I also liked that there were families dining here on week night. It's nice to find another place close to home where I can bring my kids that's not ordering at the counter and linoleum tables.

Nono's is a great neighborhood restaurant.  I love the atmosphere and the old time photos on the walls.   For appetizers be sure to try the Pino Puffs!  The pastas are wonderful and they give you enough for an extra meal to take home.  My favorite is the Spicy Seafood Ravioli.  If you save room for desert the Gelato and Tiramisu is delicious!

Amazing!!!!!  From the service to the food .  Food runners and bus boys were absolutely great, the waitstaff was great, the owner / jack of all trades was fantastic. He came by to our table to make sure all was well! I had dropped my napkin on the floor from my lap which i planned to pick up and use like a normal person, but he would not let me and got me another napkin. Now that is service!  Food was so exceptional . . . 3 adults shared 3 meals all came with a salad or soup. Lasagna , chicken bow tie, and the Dover Sole special. To die For ... All 3. I would come back here anytime!!!!  What is even better, is that they are in the Entertainment book!!!  WOW  JpN

Nice neighborhood place we can walk to.Service is friendly. Busboys are a little to quick to take your plates and you feel like they are starring at you while you are eating. As for the food. Penne Broccoli was fairly good but not like it use to be. The dish I had was Bowtie Chicken Pasta. Absolulely Horrible. Chicken had no flavor and was complete fatty and every bite seemed to be a bite of gristle. I had to pick it all out. We were glad to leave.The area has so many good places to eat and with competition from the wonderful Italian restaurant down and across the street you would think they would strive for excellence.

I've been passing by this Italian restaurant in Edison Park for years and I finally got in there when I attended a baptism party. From the outside, Nonno Pino seems so small, but once you step through the door, you see it runs deep, many booths and tables all the way to the back wall where their kitchen is located. The walls are bare brick and the place has that old building charm to it. We had a reserved section near the middle of the restaurant. Within minutes of beaing seated, loaves of warm, fresh-baked, hard-crusted Italian bread appeared on the table. Served with olive oil and parmesian cheese, we could keep going with just the bread. My kids gobbled up their bread and even got a second loaf brought to the table.  Then came the appetizers. Now I like calamari but this was the best calamari I ever tried. It was tender, not chewy. Much like the bread, I found myself unable to stop eating the calamari as well. Then came the bruschetta, equally delightful. At some point, I realized I wouldn't have much lunch getting filled up on these with the best yet to come. They delivered the goods with beef and chicken platters . I stuck with the chicken - legs and wings. Additionally, there were platters of pasta. I loved the bowtie pasta in a somewhat creamy tomato sauce. For the kids, they brought personal pizzas. Each one was probably 2 meals' worth, so they had some to pack up and take home for leftovers too. As if I wasn't full enough, the desserts came out. I had a piece of tiramisu, one of my favorite Italian desserts. Service was attentive and the overall dining experience excellent. Excellent place for a lunch, dinner or reception.

The food is very good. However, if you are looking for a night out with your friends  where you can eat and have  pleasant conversation, forget it! It's so noisy and loud, you can't hear anything.   We will not return here.

Stopped in for a group dinner last Thursday and the bar was packed with Chicago firefighters following Captain Herbie Johnson's funeral.  Once we fought our way through the crowd to the back of the restaurant, we enjoyed a decent meal (mostly appetizers, soup and salads). Highly recommend the baked goat cheese and breaded rigatoni. The rustic salad with pears, strawberries, walnuts and gorgonzola cheese was very tasty. Skip the chicken vegetable soup though.

Average food, nice atmosphere, decent wait staff.   Arugula beet salad was very light on the beets and was soaked in dressing.  House salad was better, get  dressing on the side.   Filet  Steak overdone.   Drenched in sauce, not very appealing.  Tried to accommodate by bringing new steak, this time too rare.  If u do eat here, stick with pasta dishes.  Tiramisu very nice.  Accommodating for parties.
I have been going there for over 10 years and this is just great food at reasonable prices.  Always good and hot and they deliver.

I feel bad it's taken me this long to write this review but I had a great time here for dinner a few months ago. The atmosphere is open but homey and the service is great. The food is very authentic Italian and out of the appetizers and entrees we ordered everything was great. Good location downtown and portions are huge- I had a lot of leftovers. I agree with everyone else that the zucchini balls were amazing.

ZUCCHINI BALLS! The best appetizer ever invented! Zucchini, breadcrumb, cheese and spices rolled into balls of deliciousness and FRIED. Served with a side of marinara. Delicious and lighter than I've described. I could have made a meal out of those, but then I would have missed out on the penne pasta w/pancetta and fresh mozzarella perfectly drizzled with extra virgin olive oil and topped with basil. I was nearly in a food coma IT WAS THAT GOOD. And I'm Italian. I know.

I'm not a huge pizza fanatic, even as a Chicago native. However, they must pour magic into their dough because it's unlike anything on the Northwest side. I've been there only once so far, but will return just for that.
Ravioli was awesome Cannoli was awesome Fast service Nice atmosphere Server was fast and efficient  The rest of the food was just okay . . .

The restaurant was great: ambience (check) location (check) food (check) beer (check) server (I don't think so) I consider myself a patient person, extremely patient in fact. But, the service we received at this other than spectacular restaurant was bewildering. I expected a much busier restaurant on a Friday night. Instead we found many empty tables throughout the room. But still, our server seemed to get lost in the kitchen and was hardly seen on the floor. We endured the slowest service I have ever experienced, including my waits in line for beer at Wrigley Field. My teeth clenched when he refused to provide separate checks. He actually made a friend underline each entrée and point out with markings the appropriate credit card to charge. How busy could this guy have been? I'm glad we didn't order ice cream. Suffice it to say that he probably wasn't happy with my tip.

We recently held our rehearsal dinner here in April and everything went perfect.  The staff is great, owners are very easy to work with and the food was delicious.  We had a total of about 45 people and the service was great all night.

Nonno Pino's is truly one of the best Italian restaurants in Chicago, and anywhere for that matter.  Their signature Pino Puff appetizers, which consist of shredded zucchini with 3 cheeses formed into a light puffy ball are the best way to start your evening.  If you're looking for pastas, the Bowtie Arrosto ( crumbled sausage, peppers, ricotta cheese, and marinara ), the Penne Pancetta ( Italian bacon, oven roasted tomatoes, onions, fresh mozzarella, and oil and garlic ), the Penne with besciamella sauce, and the Bowtie Chicken ( with spinach, oven roasted tomatoes, and sun-dried tomato cream sauce ) are all winners.  Their Italian sausage is very chargrilled, and is some of the best Italian sausage around.  Great bar for drinks before dinner, too.  Very good, and very authentic Italian pasta dishes.  The best.   As far as Entrees are concerned, the Chicken Vesuvio, Chicken With Mushrooms ( Chicken Marsala ), and the Pistachio Crusted Chicken are all truly outstanding.  The Pistachio Crusted Chicken is one of their most popular dishes, and for good reason- it's the best dish on a menu already full of great, authentic choices.  The chicken breast is lightly breaded in pistachios and served with a roasted pepper cream sauce, with both grilled polenta and grilled asparagus.  It is truly unique to Nonno Pino's, and it's the best chicken dish I've ever had in any style or ethnic version of chicken anywhere.  And you can never go wrong with their Grilled Filet, which comes with gorgonzola cheese, a chianti demi-glaze with mashed potatoes, and grilled asparagus.   Finally, for dessert, Nonno Pino's Tiramisu is excellent.  I've never really liked Tiramisu, but Nonno Pino's is the lone exception.  It's light and airy/fluffy, and it's perfectly sweet.  And their cannolis are the best in Chicago, and are often served with strawberries.  However, their cannolis don't have the pistachios that are commonly found everywhere else, nor do they have the chocolate chips in the filling.  Instead, the chef puts a slight drizzle of chocolate over the entire cannoli, which allows the natural flavor of the homemade cannoli filling to really shine through, without the distractions of the chocolate chips and the pistachios that everyone else uses to make up for average cannoli filling at other restaurants.   Nonno Pino's is also a great place to have bridal showers, baby showers, rehearsal dinners, wedding receptions, baptisms, and any other private party you're looking to have.  The owners are ALWAYS there, and they will most definitely accomodate whatever needs you have.  Both of the owners come from excellent local Italian food backgrounds ( i.e. Elmwood Park ), and both their service and attention to detail are on full display on any given night at Nonno Pino's.  The entire staff is also very family friendly.  When it comes to authentic Italian cuisine in a city full of Italian restaurants, Nonno Pino's is truly the best in the business.
Good atmosphere, decent prices, and okay food.  Although the grilled calamari was fantastic.  I would go back but would like a friendlier server.

Really not good. My husband and I both ordered from the specials board. His was overcooked lumps of pork. Mine was a plate full of big balls of ground pork sausage that someone had opened a can of white beans over, and then poured over a can of chicken broth. And it was cold. To be fair, our server was good. I'm not one to complain in the restaurant about my food...and I didn't, but she could tell that something was wrong and offered to bring me a new dish. I decided to go with something simple--the salad with beets was edible. I was glad they took it off our bill, without our having to ask. We didn't try the pasta, but saw several plates going out. I have to say they did not look any more appetizing. Reviewers seem to like the large portions and reasonable prices, and I can confirm both of those. I just can't say it's actually worth eating here.

You ever see that show Kitchen Nightmares?  Nonno Pino's feels like the restaurants on that show right after they get the Gordon Ramsey makeover.  From the retrofitted decor to the attentive service to the unexpected twists and turns of the menu options, it just had that feel.  And, that's not a bad thing!  Just an observation. Overall, food was reasonably priced and somewhat creative.  We had two of the specials - salmon and pork loin. It did seem like the chef might be a bit prosciutto happy as both dishes had a piece somewhat unnecessarily thrown on top.  Rustic salad was excellent as was the gelato for dessert, but, in terms of the main course, I think the best thing either of us ate was the sweet potatoes that came with the salmon entree. We stopped by here as we were coming back to the city from an Abt trip, so it was convenient, but I wouldn't go out of your way to hit this joint. Did want to mention that service was excellent and all were very polite and helpful, which was much appreciated!

We came here for an early dinner on a Saturday night. There are a number of restaurants here in Edison Park, so it is tough to find a place to park, but Nonno Pino's has valet parking, so you don't have park four blocks away, like we did! We had last been to Nonno Pino's over a year ago on a of previous trip to the area and enjoyed our meal, so looked forward to returning.  The restaurant is kind of trendy, casual. It is very open with high ceilings, old wood floors, and old brick walls. You sit at tables (no booths) with white tablecloths, covered with white paper. On one wall hangs a large blackboard that has the day's specials. The bar is in the front of the restaurant, but no walls separate it from the dining area. The wait staff is very attentive and friendly. (Our water glasses never dropped below 7/8th's full!) After being seated you are brought a basket of tasty, warm bread and a small plate of olive oil and olives piled with parmesan cheese. We asked for balsamic vinegar to add to the olive oil and were quickly brought a small shaker filled with balsamic. We know the portions are large here, so we shared the Bowtie Pasta with crumbled sausage, red bell peppers, ricotta cheese and marinara sauce. To start our meal we shared their Caprese salad and minestrone soup.  The Caprese salad here is unlike any other we have had in other Italian restaurants. Usually Caprese salad consists of slices of tomato sandwiched between slices mozzarella and chopped basil. The small salad we ordered had two slices of tomato between topped with mozzarella and topped with basil, laying on top of chopped lettuce. It was good, but not exactly what we were expecting. The minestrone soup had lots of chunks of fresh vegetables and a tasty, tomatoey broth. The waiter was very indulgent with us since we gave his arm a workout grinding fresh parmesan cheese into our soup! They spilt the pasta dish for us, which was a good thing because one of us could not have eaten the whole thing! Even with the split we both stuffed ourselves cleaning our plates, because it was delicious! We embellished our pasta with fresh ground parmesan cheese and gave our waiter another arm workout... We wished we had room for their Tiramisu since we remembered how good it was from our last visit...Oh, well...It will give us something to look forward to on our next visit...

Food is great, service is always awesome! We showed up a few weeks ago unannounced with a big group, and they went out of their way to accommodate us. The staff did all they could to make us feel welcome, and we had a great time. Oh yeah, the food was as good as left overs the next day as it was at the restaurant. Kudos Nonno Pinos!

This place is a favorite by everyone in my family. The food is exceptional and you can actually stretch your arms out if needed without hitting someone at a table next to you which can't be said for the other Italian joint in town. Their Frieds Clams, Gnocchi Besciamella, Seafood Ravioli and Asiago Chicken are all amazing. They have so many great dishes on the menu and their prices are very reasonable. This is by far the best place in Edison Park to have a sit down meal and a few drinks with a few friends and be able to hear your conversation. If you are in the area in the summer time there are a few tables up by the front where the windows open to create a feeling like you are outside. When the weather is nice there is no better place to sit and enjoy a drink!

WOW.  Went here with my in-laws because they were staying at a hotel near O'Hare. It was super busy because it was a Saturday night, but we were still seated fast, and it didn't seem to affect the service, which was great. We started out with the Pino Puffs....SOOO yummy...fried, but still really light, with shredded zucchini and cheese in sort of a fritter form.  We also got the baked goat cheese to start and that was also really tasty. My husband loved his gnocchi beciamella, and my mother-in-law had the penne tri-colore, which she also really enjoyed.  My father-in-law got the pistachio crusted chicken and I got the asiago crusted chicken.  Both were absolutely delicious, and perfectly cooked.    I always have room for dessert....especially when it's Tiramisu, and I'm glad I did, because it was amazing.  My husband, who is a native New Yorker and really picky about his cannolis, LOVED the cannoli here. He said it was totally authentic.   We would DEFINITELY go back.

The 2nd star is for convenience and specials. Not only is it 3 blocks from home but the ambiance works for semi-professional meetings/after work drinks. Also efficient - rare waits for seating or food. The drink/bar snack specials are also convenient - the wine selection is good. If you want to eat, Zia's across the street has real food, Italian at that. Don Juan's just down the street has very good Mexican food and larger bar area but is a little more casual.

I recently held a party here for my Mom's birthday and was really impressed with everything.  The party was easy to plan, the manager and staff were so accommodating and the food and drink were excellent.  I definitely recommend Nonno Pino.

I love Nonno Pino's!!  I used to live in Edison Park a few years back and previous to that grew up in Park Ridge.  So I have been dining at Nonno's for going on 12 years.  It is the BEST restaurant in the area. WAY better then Zia's!  Everything is great about it.  The food, service, people, and atmosphere!  If you haven't been, you must go!!  My personal cocktail fav's: Dirty Martini French Martini Chocolate Martini Red Diamond Merlot - my fav red wine My personal dinner fav's: (hard to choose b/c EVERYTHING is good) Pino Puffs - must try!   Baked Goat Cheese Grilled Calamari - over the Caesar salad - the best!  Crab Cakes - 4 stars!  Rustic Salad Chicken Pizza Michaelangelo Sandwich - My all time fav Rigatoni Broccoli Bowtie Chicken Pistachio Crusted Chicken Asiago Crusted Chicken Tiramisu Bread Pudding As you can see from all the dishes I  just recommended I really really love this place!!  And you will too!
I happened upon this place while driving through Edison Park---a neighborhood I'd never been to before. Just took a chance and really enjoyed the food/atmosphere.

summer time sitting by the huge open windows in the front...can't get better than that for atmosphere.   We have been there many time, and I have never had a bad meal.  They are true to the Italian roots and make a delish gnocchi and seafood ravioli.  The bread comes out warm with olive oil and cheese.   Great selection of wine, they have a full bar. There is valet parking, Edison Park is a very hopping area.
It's okay... But not as good as home cooked Italian food. My cousin makes better Italian food at home.... Hmmmm.

Went here for a wedding reception last Saturday, so we got special treatment as the whole place was closed for our great private party.  First, from the bar area to the seating for dining, it has an inviting feel as a family Italian restaurant. It reminds me of places you'll find on Mulberry Street in New York's Little Italy. Then the food didn't disappoint either. The wedding menu included gnocchi in a tomato cream sauce, and Vesuvio-like chicken. Although those, with the salad and bread were tasty, the desserts, followed by a special serving of midnight pizza, were divine. I had a cannoli and a piece of chocolate cake. Not too decadent on either, just the right sweetness level. Then after hours of an open bar, the pizza really hit the spot. Great traditional flavors, such as margherita and sausage.  It was nice to have something to celebrate here, because the restaurant had a great atmosphere for just that. When I'm back in the Edison Park area, however, the only occasion I'll need to come back to this place is being hungry on any given night.

Great food! I had the grilled halibut special and it was delicious. My fellow eaters had pork chops, Asiago chicken, and the artichoke chicken. Our least favorite was the artichoke chicken. It was good, but the chicken needed a better sear to it. Good portions and a relaxed atmosphere for a Thursday night out. Martinis were on special for 4 bucks and tasted great!

Excellent, casual italian food. Big portions. Which is great, because I eat half of it.. and stuff the other half down my pants.. I love it so much. I make the trek all the way from Wicker Park to eat here. Wonderful attentive service every time. Highly recommend!

Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Edison Park. The food is out of this world and the ambiance is great. Most of our family get-togethers are held here and the owners have always been very nice to us - checking on our food and all that. The portions are huge and the prices aren't ridiculous. The servers are great. Just all around an amazing Italian restaurant.

Unfortunately, we were very disappointed with the greeting we received. After giving our name, the host finally looks up and asks us if we have a reservation. We repeated our name and the hostess that brought us to the table never smiled or said anything, just pretty much threw the menus on the table and walked away. The waiter was good and the bread with olive oil and cheese very tasty. The dinner salads were ok, very small and uncreative. I ordered a special - portabella mushroom ravioli on top of marinara, covered with alfredo - it was excellent. My friend ordered the meat ravioli and it was just ok. If the rest of the service and/or if the food had not been good, I would have given one star..first impressions are everything.

I've had the pleasure of coming here for lunch on many occasions and I have never been disappointed. They have a good selection of appetizers, pastas and thin crust pizzas. So far I've been there a handful of times and I've liked every dish. Favorites include: Pino Puffs, Pistachio crusted chicken, Bowtie Arrosto and the Yo, Tony! sandwich  I like the look of the place with its open and spacious bar dining room. I love going there in the warmer months when you can sit in the front area and they open up some big windows.  I will definitely try to come back for dinner since lunch is always a hit at Nonno Pino's.

Nonnos is a great place for dinner with friends or something more romantic.  I also like eating at the bar.  We met the owner on a slow night and he really made us feel @ home.  He also threw in a couple free drinks.  This place has a loyal following of nw side neighbors, nice bartenders, and excellent italian food.  I had the pork tenderloin which was very good.

We stopped in for lunch, and Nonno Pino didn't disappoint. The bread that accompanies the olive oil and cheese was crusty, warm, and perfect for dunking. We split the "Classico" (meatball sandwich) and the "Hey Joey" (grilled portobello mushrooms, roasted red peppers, spinach, and gorgonzola) and both were quite satisfying. I rarely order meatball sandwiches, because obviously nobody makes them better than Mom, and while this still hold true after trying Nonno Pino's, I actually enjoyed them. There was a substantial amount of gorgonzola on the Hey Joey, which was unexpected but amazing, because most places are usually pretty stingy with it. Overall, in the unlikely event I'm back in the area, I wouldn't mind going again, but I doubt I'll make a specific trip.
A great place to take a date or grab a beer with a few friends on a summer night. They always have great specials that are seasonal and fresh as well as a perfect pasta

I don't understand why this place gets such good reviews. Maybe we ordered all the wrong things. We got the baked clams. They were sort of fishy tasting. We also got a pizza and the eggplant rolls. Not impressed with the sauces and the pizza crust was bad. Kind of doughy and undercooked.  The eggplant rolls were filled with a bland ricotta and covered with tons of mozzarella.  The wine list was limited. Not many Italian choices.  Decor was a combination of authentic and commercial.  Would come back only to go to the bar.

The atmosphere inside is wonderful.  Very clean, classy with a rustic feel to it with the exposed brick and hardwood floors.  The wait staff was just right.  No hovering around you, no excessive checking to see if everything was good.  Because the food isn't served by the person who takes your order, we had to wait for some Parmesan cheese to be brought to us, but other than that, the rest of the time was perfect. I thoroughly enjoyed my Chicken Bowtie but I'm sad to say my boyfriend didn't care at all for this lasagna. It was rather runny and he still says to this day (after over 6 months since we ate there) that it's one of the worst lasagnas he has ever had.  He ate it, because he's one of those folks who is afraid to complain about food in a restaurant in fear that they will do something to his food if he sends it back.  lol A very enjoyable meal...as long as you don't have the lasagna.  If you've had exceptional lasagna in the past you will be disappointed.  If you've never tried lasagna in the past this will make you think that you were right in avoiding it and wouldn't try again. I would have given this place 5 stars if it wasn't for the lasagna.

This place is SO yummy and cute. The staff is tentative and knowledgeable. I LOVE the bread here!!! I travel to Chicago for work, and we come here every year. I look forward to it each year. That's how great it is. And the wine list is pretty good! Overall, a win- win situation. Not sure about the price though, as they hook us us! :)
Good solid place with a nice selection of Italian food!!

I shouldn't be surprised of another great Italian restaurant out in Edison Park.  I have been here a couple of times, and love the food here.
